intro: Echinocystis gemella, commonly known as the small bursche or lesser bursche, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is a vine that produces small, spiny fruits resembling burrs, which are characteristic of its genus. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the gourd family.
